poem:
### Hexham Tragedy

in the quiet of the alley  
shadows twisted into fate—  
youth, a tender symphony  
drowned in jealous rage—  
36 beats of the heart stopped  
by the knife's cruel chime,  
where innocence once wandered,  
ghosts now hover,  
the echoes of unresolved mornings  
lingering—love lost  
to nightfalls never dreamt.
